docs.lead_paragraph: One of the issues in the city's rate cases against Blue Cross is the question of how effectively the nonprofit insurance carrier has policed hospital costs. Since 1964, the last time Blue Cross instituted a rate increase, the average cost of hospital care in the New York metropolitan area has jumped from $50.80 to $86.90 a day -- a 71 per cent rise that has far out-stripped the rise in the cost of liv ing

headline.main: Blue Cross Under Fire; Insurance Plan's Policies Challenged As Hospital's Costs and Rates Increase
